author: A D
text:
loss of green cover:A sudden fire in a hillock in the Sathuvacharai hill destroyed plants in Vellore on Saturday.- Photo: C. Venkatachalapathy

A sudden fire, said to be caused by miscreants, occurred on Saturday in a hillock near Vellore and destroyed the greenery there.

There are three hillocks near Vellore including the one near Sathuvachari. The fire occurred where a historic fort stands. The fort is said to have been built by a Maratha king.

According to the locals, fires are a common occurrence in the hillocks during summer.

Covered by lemongrass

Moreover the hillocks are abundantly covered only by lemongrass (Manjam pul).

Ashraf Ali, an archaeologist says there is lack of interest in safeguarding the monuments and in improving the green cover.

Local people say activists’s view that restoration of green cover will help bring down the temperature of the city is also overlooked.
title: Fire in Vellore hillock destroys greenery
